title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 March 2017 - XWiki
content:
<Aranjedeath> has quit  
02:01 <OSIMasson1> has quit  
03:24 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
07:27 <simfir\_> has quit  
07:28 <simfir> has joined #xwiki  
08:29 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: hi  
08:29 <vmassol> you may be interested by this comment by a user on our list: "Second, I want all applications, blog, sandbox, ... gone from what users see. When I try to delete these pages I get the warning that I should instead remove the extension ..."  
08:29 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:31 <LudovicDubost[m]> And if you try to delete the extension some bad stuff will happen.. we really need optional bundled extensions  
08:31 <vmassol> yes  
08:32 <LudovicDubost[m]> And extension deleting warnings for content package is discussable  
08:33 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:49 <Ulydev> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <vmassol> tmortagne and others: FYI just downloaded 9.1.2 and I don't the extension page protectionon deletion. Is that normal?  
08:55 <tmortagne1> vmassol: not sure why you ask me, I'm not the one who worked on this  
08:55 <vmassol> Ludovic Dubost: uninstallig the blog worked for me so the issue is probably fixed already. Thomas?  
08:55 <vmassol> tmortagne: in case you know and beczause you were the RM :)  
08:55 <tmortagne1> not exactly  
08:55 <vmassol> I've pinged GD already  
08:55 <tmortagne1> I was not 9.1 RM  
08:55 <vmassol> but he's not connected yet  
08:55 <vmassol> yes I know  
08:56 <vmassol> that's the side effect of being knowledgable: people ask you questions ;)  
08:56 <vmassol> don't worry, I'll wait for GD  
08:56 <vmassol> :)  
08:56 <vmassol> regarding uninstallation of core extensions though maybe you could help me  
08:56 <vmassol> did we fix the issue (I don't remember)?  
08:57 <vmassol> I was happily surprised to be able to uninstall the blog app  
08:58 <tmortagne1> blog app is not a core extension and not being able to uninstall code extension is a feature not an issue  
08:58 <tmortagne1> blog app is not a core extension and not being able to uninstall core extension is a feature not an issue  
08:58 <vmassol> maybe I'm usinf the wrong terminology  
08:58 <vmassol> but AFAIK not long ago uninstalling the blog app for ex would also uninstall the flavor, no?  
08:59 <tmortagne1> if the flavor has the blog as dependency it will uninstall the flavor  
08:59 <vmassol> I'm talking about XE thomas  
08:59 <vmassol> so XE has a dep on the blog for sure  
09:00 <vmassol> and I was able to uninstall the blog and I don't see anything missing in my wiki  
09:00 <tmortagne1> not exactly, XE mainwiki flavor has but not subwiki  
09:00 <tmortagne1> uninstall the flavor does not means uninstall everything  
09:00 <tmortagne1> it means uninstall the flavor extension that's all  
09:01 <vmassol> ok so the user won't notice  
09:01 <tmortagne1> it depends  
09:02 <vmassol> until the next upgrade  
09:02 <vmassol> maybe  
09:02 <tmortagne1> the home page is part of the flavor  
09:02 <vmassol> the home page is still there  
09:02 <tmortagne1> if you modified it sure  
09:02 <vmassol> I didn't  
09:02 <vmassol> it's a clean hsqldb/jetty 9.1.2  
09:03 <Ulydev> Hello! I stumbled across your GSoC page and after taking a look at your project ideas, I'd be interested in working on the "translation in context" project.  
09:03 <Ulydev> If I understand correctly, it would be a UI extension to simplify the l10n.xwiki.org translation process?  
09:04 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <tmortagne1> vmassol: I just downloaded 9 jetty/hsqldb 9.1.2 and when I unsinatll the blog I get the XE main wiki flavor in the uninstall plan  
09:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: yes me too  
09:05 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you remember the jira issue related to being able to uninstall a extension without uninstzalling the flavor?  
09:05 <tmortagne1> actually forget that the home page is not in this flavor  
09:05 <tmortagne1> it's in platform flavor  
09:05 <tmortagne1> I think XE mainwiki flavor is pretty much empty these days  
09:05 <vmassol> so the issue will be when you uprgade the WAR next time?  
09:06 <vmassol> DW won't find the flavor and won't propose to upgrade it?  
09:06 <vmassol> or it won't know the current version  
09:06 <vmassol> it'll find it in the meatdata  
09:06 <tmortagne1> I confirm it's totally empty, see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/tree/master/xwiki-enterprise-ui/xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwiki  
09:06 <tmortagne1> DW does not work that way  
09:06 <tmortagne1> it does not care about what you have  
09:06 <vmassol> hmms trange that blog is in th're  
09:06 <tmortagne1> it look at the WAT to know what to install  
09:07 <tmortagne1> known as "default extension UI"  
09:07 <vmassol> yes but it won't know the verdsion installaed  
09:07 <tmortagne1> it does not need to  
09:07 <vmassol> yes but it won't know the version installed  
09:07 <tmortagne1> it will propose you to install the default UI  
09:07 <vmassol> ok so for blog it'll work  
09:07 <tmortagne1> and it install it and upgrade the dependencies  
09:08 <vmassol> trying sandbox now  
09:08 <tmortagne1> the "repair" phase is just a migration hack you get when you don't have any extension installed  
09:08 <tmortagne1> the "repair" phase is just a migration hack you get when you don't have any extension installed (DW consider you come from a old style world)  
09:09 <vmassol> ok sandox is a bigger issue  
09:09 <vmassol> removes a lot more since it removes ui common  
09:09 <vmassol> do you have the jira issue for this?  
09:09 <tmortagne1> no  
09:10 <vmassol> it's becoming a blocker now  
09:10 <vmassol> with Guillaume's protection  
09:11 <tmortagne1> Ulydev: yes excatly, the idea is to provide a new way to contribute translations (it also make easier to have custom translation locally even if you don't "push" them)  
09:11 <tmortagne1> vmassol: guillaume protection does not prevent you from deleting extension pages  
09:11 <tmortagne1> it warn you  
09:11 <vmassol> yes  
09:11 <vmassol> put yourself in a user's shoes  
09:12 <vmassol> it says ti recommends to uninstall the exyension  
09:12 <vmassol> so that's what a user will try to do  
09:13 <Ulydev> Nice, I like the idea. There could be some kind of popover when you select text (https://raw.githubusercontent.com/VincentLoy/share-selected-text/master/demo/sst.jpg) to make it even easier!  
09:13 <Ulydev> I'll look into the code to see how translation currently works :)  
09:14 <tmortagne1> Ulydev: the idea on gsoc.xwiki.org indicate the technical possibilities but them it's up to the student to propose what you do with it ;)  
09:15 <Ulydev> great!  
09:16 <tmortagne1> this remaind me I need to add something in the description  
09:17 <tmortagne1> Ulydev: you might be interrested by what I just added  
09:18 <tmortagne1> (see the notification)  
09:18 <Ulydev> Oh, alright, the URL parameter  
09:19 <tmortagne1> note that translation macro is still not used everywhere (far from it) but supported only that for now is ok in the context of the GSOC  
09:19 <tmortagne1> this tool will incitate developer to use the macro more :)  
09:26 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <faichelbaum> @vmassol: for the doctree perf issue on my 9.1.2 migrated from a 8.4, I confirm thaat updating the pseudo terminal pages as real terminal pages (advanced user moving them and ticking the checkbox) solved the issue. No more perf issue in the tree  
09:50 <vmassol> that's weird. It probably deserves a jira issue. mflorea1 : are you aware of such as issue?  
09:50 <vmassol> it's not normal that terminal pages would slow down the doc tree  
09:50 <vmassol> faichelbaum: would you mind creating a jira issue for this?  
09:53 <Ulydev> has quit  
10:00 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <vmassol> hey guys, seems I have a little hard time explaining things to this Patrick Hausen on the list. If you want to chime in on the thread don't hesitate ;)  
11:17 <mflorea> vmassol: I tested with lots of terminal and non-terminal pages the doc tree performance and there was no problem. faichelbaum must have something else.  
11:18 <mflorea> as can be seen from http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13468?focusedCommentId=92225&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-92225  
11:19 <mflorea> #if ($mathtool.random < 0.5)  
11:19 <mflorea>   ## Terminal page  
11:20 <mflorea> so from 5000 pages, half were terminal  
13:49 <OSIMasson1> has quit  
14:07 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <faichelbaum> @vmassol @mflorea, will do so. Sorry for the belated answer, was suck in meetings all morning long 'til lately :/  
15:29 <vmassol> faichelbaum: np  
15:45 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> has joined #xwiki  
15:54 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> has quit  
16:33 <gdelhumeau> the build is broken  
16:33 <gdelhumeau> but it's not related to my changes: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/3764/console  
16:36 <tmortagne1> gdelhumeau: yes my fault, wanted to finish some stuff before committing the platform part. Did not think the commons side would break platform  
16:37 <cjd[m]1> has joined #xwiki  
16:51 <msmeria> has quit  
17:02 <acotiuga> has quit  
18:01 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:09 <mflorea> has quit  
19:14 <Ulydev> has joined #xwiki  
19:43 <floflobel> has quit  
19:44 <Slashman> has quit  
19:50 <OSIMasson1> has quit  
20:04 <Ulydev> has quit  
20:10 <Ulydev> has joined #xwiki  
20:10 <systemd> has quit  
20:11 <systemd> has joined #xwiki  
20:27 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
21:00 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
21:03 <OSIMasson1> has quit  
22:04 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
22:16 <mflorea> has quit  
23:36 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
23:42 <systemd> has quit  
23:42 <systemd> has joined #xwiki
